meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sketchy.
meanings.sent1: The sketchiness of the plan made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't trust him due to the sketchiness of his story.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't help but chuckle at the sketchiness of the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The sketchiness of the situation painted a dark cloud over the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The sketchiness of the old house gave it an eerie vibe.

meanings.definition: A feeling or impression of uncertainty or suspicion.
meanings.sent1: Her sketchiness about the new project raised concerns among the team.
meanings.sent2: The sketchiness in his eyes made me question his motives.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sketchiness, he managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The sketchiness of the email made her hesitate before clicking any links.
meanings.sent5: The sketchiness of the situation lingered in the air, making everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: A rough or unfinished drawing or design.
meanings.sent1: The artist's sketchiness captured the essence of the moment.
meanings.sent2: She quickly sketched the sketchiness of the landscape before the light changed.
meanings.sent3: The sketchiness of the doodle made her burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His sketchiness of the city skyline was both abstract and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The sketchiness of the blueprint left room for creative interpretation.
